snippet: The outbreak of a type of meningitis linked to back pain injections has spread, with over 30 cases, four of them fatal, in Tennessee, North Carolina, Florida, Virginia and Maryland.
abstract: Health officials say outbreak of rare meningitis, linked to spinal injections for back pain, is growing and has killed four people and sickened at least 30 others in Tennessee, North Carolina, Florida, Virginia and Maryland; new cases are said to be appearing daily.
lead_paragraph: The outbreak of a type of meningitis linked to back pain injections has spread, with over 30 cases, four of them fatal, in Tennessee, North Carolina, Florida, Virginia and Maryland.

headline.seo: Meningitis Outbreak Grows, With Cases in 5 States
headline.main: In Outbreak, Meningitis Is Reported in 5 States
headline.print_headline: In Outbreak, Meningitis Is Reported In 5 States
